oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Williams: Beyond the Legend Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of 3. Recording is of the documentary Hank Williams: Beyond the Legend. Documentary is hosted by Kyle Cantrell and includes commentary from Johnnie Bailes (personality), Bob Wills (performer), Jud Collins (performer) and Merle Kilgore (executive).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Williams Sr.; Kyle Cantrell; Johnnie Bailes; Bob Wills; Jud Collins; Merle Kilgore
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:06) An unknown voice discusses a space mission -- (00:06) Unidentified Tune [excerpt] ([Unidentified]) -- (00:13) Church World Service commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (01:14) Kyle Cantrell introduces Hank Williams, Beyond the Legend -- (01:58) Never Again (Will I Knock on Your Door) (Hank Williams) -- (04:29) Cantrell discusses Hank Williams Sr.'s early recording career and his lack of success -- (05:57) Bob Wills and Cantrell discuss how he was approached with the possibility to work with Hank Williams Sr. -- (08:30) Wealth Won't Save Your Soul (Hank Williams Sr. and the Oklahoma Wranglers) -- (11:25) Fruehauf Trailer commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (12:24) Cantrell discusses how Williams Sr. trusted Fred Rose -- (12:56) An unknown voice recites Hank Williams Sr. contract with Fred Rose -- (14:14) Alzheimer's commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (15:17) U. S. Department of Education commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (16:16) Music Country Radio Network commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (16:46) Move it on Over [featuring Cantrell voice over] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (19:25) Cantrell discusses Williams Sr. decision to move to perform on KWKH -- (20:28) Merle Kilgore recalls how he was impressed by Williams Sr. -- (22:08) Whistler Truckers Move America (Unconfirmed) [featuring an unknown voiceover] -- (23:07) TNN commercial hosted by an unknown voice -- (24:06) Cantrell reflects on Williams Sr. tenure at the Louisiana Hayride -- (24:31) Johnnie Bailes discusses on how Williams Sr. was originally denied a tryout on the Louisiana Hayride -- (25:54) Cantrell discusses Williams Sr.'s early MGM success -- (26:10) On the Banks of the Old Pontchartrain [excerpt] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (26:33) Fly Trouble [excerpt] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (26:48) Rootie Tootie [excerpt] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (27:06) My Sweet Love Ain't Around [excerpt] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (27:44) The Blues Come Around [excerpt] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (27:55) I'm a Long Gone Daddy [excerpt] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (28:16) I Can't Get You Off of My Mind [excerpt] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (28:35) A Mansion on the Hill [excerpt] (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (29:00) Cantrell introduces Kilgore -- (29:09) Kilgore reflects on Williams Sr.'s ego -- (29:48) Cantrell introduces Williams Sr's segment on KWKH -- (30:01) Little Paper Boy (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (33:01) Cantrell introduces the commercial break -- (33:16) The American Council of Education commercial presented by Johnny Cash -- (34:18) Church World Service commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (35:17) Music Country Radio Network commercial presented by an unknown voice -- (35:47) Love Sick Blues [featuring Cantrell voice over] (Emmett Miller) -- (37:05) Cantrell reveals how Hank Williams Sr. first discovered "Love Sick Blues" -- (37:30) Love Sick Blues [excerpt] [featuring Cantrell voice over] (Hank Williams Sr) -- (38:18) Love Sick Blues (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (41:01) Reba McEntire performs the commercial break for Goodies [featuring "Whoever's in New England"] -- (42:01) Dello commercial presented by Jackie Robinson -- (43:02) Cantrell discusses William's new found popularity and the Grand Ole Opry's interest -- (43:58) Jud Collins recalls the first time he met Hank Williams Sr. -- (45:12) Cantrell discusses the WSM officials' response to his growing interest from around the world -- (45:52) Grant Turner explains WSM's fears when it came to their image -- (46:39) Cantrell reflects on Williams Sr.'s implications on WSM -- (47:19) Turner discusses how the Grand Ole Opry finally accepted Williams Sr. -- (49:07) You're Gonna Change (Or I'm a Gonna Leave) (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (51:36) Cantrell introduces the commercial break -- (51:48) Satellite commercial presented by Hue Downs -- (52:48) [Unknown jingle] -- (53:15) [Tape is reversed] (Unrelated to rest of tape)
